intro: Lapeirousia plagiostoma, commonly known as the Orange River daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers with red markings. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces strap-shaped leaves and has a compact, bushy growth habit. Lapeirousia plagiostoma is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries.
